metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the linux-def:rpminfo_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the linux-def:rpminfo_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the rpminfo_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the rpminfo_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the rpminfo_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.

rpminfo_test.comment: Test that the rpminfo_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the rpminfo_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the rpminfo_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.

rpminfo_object.comment: Retrieve an rpminfo_item with a name equal to 'rpm'.
rpminfo_object.name: rpm

rpminfo_object.comment: Retrieve rpminfo_items with names that are not equal to 'rpm'.
rpminfo_object.name: rpm

rpminfo_object.comment: Retrieve rpminfo_items with names that match the regular expression '^r.m$'.
rpminfo_object.name: ^r.m$

rpminfo_state.comment: This state represents an rpminfo_item that has a name equal to 'rpm', and an arch, epoch, release, version, evr, and signature_keyid that match the regular expression '.*'.
rpminfo_state.name: rpm

rpminfo_state.comment: This state represents rpminfo_items that have a name not equal to 'rpm', and an arch, epoch, release, version, evr, and signature_keyid that match the regular expression '.*'.
rpminfo_state.name: rpm

rpminfo_state.comment: This state represents rpminfo_items that have a name that matches the regular expression '^r.m$' and an arch, epoch, release, version, evr, and signature_keyid that match the regular expression '.*'.
rpminfo_state.name: ^r.m$
